original_solution_mapping.L1: A fifth of the apples have worms, so Lex has to throw 85 / 5 = <<85/5=17>>17 apples away.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Nine more have bruises than worms, so Lex has 17 + 9 = <<17+9=26>>26 apples for applesauce.
original_solution_mapping.L3: He picked 85 apples, so Lex has 85 - 26 - 17 = <<85-26-17=42>>42 apples left to eat raw.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5798.
    Returns: the number of apples Lex will have left to eat raw.
    """
    # L1
    total_apples = 85 # He picked 85 apples.
    worm_fraction_denominator = 5 # a fifth of the apples have worms
    wormy_apples = total_apples / worm_fraction_denominator

    # L2
    additional_bruised_apples = 9 # nine more than one fifth are bruised
    bruised_apples = wormy_apples + additional_bruised_apples

    # L3
    apples_to_eat_raw = total_apples - bruised_apples - wormy_apples

    # FA
    answer = apples_to_eat_raw
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: A fifth of the apples have worms, so Lex has to throw {total_apples} / {worm_fraction_denominator} = <<{total_apples}/{worm_fraction_denominator}={wormy_apples}>>{wormy_apples} apples away.
Nine more have bruises than worms, so Lex has {wormy_apples} + {additional_bruised_apples} = <<{wormy_apples}+{additional_bruised_apples}={bruised_apples}>>{bruised_apples} apples for applesauce.

He picked {total_apples} apples, so Lex has {total_apples} - {bruised_apples} - {wormy_apples} = <<{total_apples}-{bruised_apples}-{wormy_apples}={apples_to_eat_raw}>>{apples_to_eat_raw} apples left to eat raw.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: A fifth of the apples have worms, so Lex has to throw 5 / 5 = <<5/5=1>>1 apples away.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Nine more have bruises than worms, so Lex has 1 + 9 = <<1+9=10>>10 apples for applesauce.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: He picked 85 apples, so Lex has 85 - 10 - 1 = <<85-10-1=74>>74 apples left to eat raw.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'worm_fraction_denominator' (5) was used instead of 'total_apples' (85).
